It looks like some kind of **[Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317110544/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=URW&ffam=Garamond%20-%20Normal&fid=8e30e280ca876c845f9eda10b75b6a50&fsize=36&text=Say%20Yes%20to%20Missions%20%2F%20But%20don't%20forget%20the%20joy%20%2F%20In%20fact%20all%20my%20reading%20outside&wrap=2)**  
What do you mean by "using it in calibre"?  
(sorry, I don't know what "calibre" is... is it a piece of software?)

If the font is embedded in a pdf the font info function in your pdf reader will identify the names of fonts used in the pdf.  
Don

Calibre is software, yes. It's for e-book management.  
Thanks for the Garamond suggestion.
